paragraphs.text: NFL 2015: Why I hope Ray Rice gets back into the game.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Last year NFL star Ray Rice committed a single act of unforgettable and inexcusable violence against then fiancee Janay Palmer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This year he and his now wife Janay hope he will be back in the NFL, a platform he has used to aggressively combat adolescent bullying in the past
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As the founder of an anti-bullying organization, I hope he gets a second chance and continues his anti-bullying crusade this year, and for many years to come
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The couple is infamous for what went down in a New Jersey casino elevator
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: where
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Ray knocked Janay out with one left-handed strike, leading to his arrest on assault charges
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Rice was later cut by the Baltimore Ravens and suspended by the NFL
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He won his appeal and is now clear to play
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a team will have him
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The couple's botched press conference in May, where he failed to publicly apologize to Janay, led many to condemn him further
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Fox Sports wrote,"Most of what(Ray Rice) said left the public and media shaking their heads."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I met with Ray the day before that botched press conference while working at the Raven's training camp to help rookies and free agents better handle experiences with high school and college bullying
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I encouraged him, when the time was right, to continue his anti-bullying crusade
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: His eyes watered
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: because he deeply wants to be a hero to children again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Why would an anti-bullying advocate want Rice to have a second chance and to stay in the anti-bullying game under the right circumstances?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because Ray's deplorable but isolated act does not come close to the damage caused by bullying
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it doesn't make him a bully
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need more people like him who, once amends are made, to combat what is now the #1 form of child abuse in America
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Rice is even willing to get political to fight bullying
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He supported "Grace's Law," a landmark, anti-cyberbullying law passed in Maryland
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "I truly hope that he continues his anti-bullying work," says Christine McComas, mother of the late Grace McComas, 15
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: whose suicide is attributed to cyberbullying
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "His help was probably the single biggest factor that led to the new anti-cyberbullying law named after our daughter, which has already saved lives. His empathy and support of our family in our worst hour will never be forgotten. I have four daughters, so I'm sensitive to domestic violence. I have no reason to believe he is a serial abuser, and think he should be given the chance to redeem himself. Maryland owes a lot to that man."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Also, people within the Ravens organization who knew Ray well told me that what happened in that elevator was inexcusable, yet also did not define Ray's real character
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Matt Lauer of the TODAY Show, while interviewing Janay, said he received numerous phone calls from people who know Ray personally
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They also said that what happened in that elevator was an aberration from his usually strong character
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Rice is guilty of a single act of inexcusable violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: an act Janay says didn't happen before and hasn't happened since that fateful day
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: By contrast, most acts of bullying are premeditated, and don't stem from flashes of anger but rather contempt and disdain toward a target
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Bullies, including domestic abusers, wed power to fear as part of a psychological campaign of cruelty in order to dominate, control, intimidate and isolate another
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet Janay says Ray's behavior before or after this one event includes none of this
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In nearly a year since the punch felt around the NFL, not one woman has come forward to accuse Rice of similar abuse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This supports Janay's statement that what happened was an isolated incident
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: something Janay said during her TODAY Show interview with Matt Lauer
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: According to Janay, good may come from this single and deplorable act
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: She told Lauer that though the claims of serial abuse are false,"God chose us for a reason."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The couple also says that this incident, which pushed Ray into mandatory and intense counseling, made them better people, including how it compelled them to rededicate themselves to their Christian faith
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we can't give the Rice family the benefit of the doubt
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: then let's give them the benefit of time this new year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which will tell us whether he has truly seen the light
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I believe that time will do more than tell
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I believe it's on his side in 2015
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Paul Coughlin is an expert witness regarding bullying and the law, a former newspaper editor and is the author of numerous books, including Raising Bully- Proof Kids
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: He is the Founder of The Protectors: Freedom From Bullying--Courage, Character & Leadership for Life
paragraphs.label: other
